Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Bioactive Glass and Allograft for Benign Bone Lesions in Children

Trial_Design.evidence: This pragmatic multicenter randomised controlled trial compared cyst recurrence after intralesional curettage and filling with allograft versus bioactive glass (BG-S53P4; Bonalive) in children aged 4 to 16 years.

Participants.evidence: in children aged 4 to 16 years. Conducted in four university hospitals in a Scandinavian country

Intervention.evidence: compared cyst recurrence after intralesional curettage and filling with allograft versus bioactive glass (BG-S53P4; Bonalive)

Method_Outcome.evidence: the primary outcome was the volume of recurrent cyst at 2-year follow-up

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using sealed envelopes, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not possible due to the distinct imaging characteristics of the materials.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 51 were randomised between October 2012 and February 2019

Number_Analysed.evidence: 51 were randomised between October 2012 and February 2019 to undergo filling with morselized allograft (26) or bioactive glass (25)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Twelve (46%) in the allograft group and 10 (40%) in the bioactive glass group developed a recurrence (OR = 0.79, 95% CI = 0.25 to 2.56, p = 0.77).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered at ClinicalTrials.gov (NCT04737590)

Funding.evidence: funded by foundations and national state research funding
